alert.note: Alert for Bath; Montgomery (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 4:02PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Montgomery and central Bath Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 402 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Klondike, or near Mount Sterling, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Klondike, Prewitt and Grassy Lick around 405 PM EDT. Mount Sterling and Levee around 410 PM EDT. Camargo, Gatewoods Station, Coons Station, Ewington and Judy around 415 PM EDT. Jeffersonville, Howards Mill, Upper Spencer, Lower Spencer, Oggs Station, Flat Creek and Stoops around 420 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Peeled Oak, Stepstone, Walkers Crossing, Hope, Owingsville, Preston, Crooks, Kendall Springs, Olympia, Bourbon Furnace, Olympia Springs, Craigs, Slate Valley, Marshall, Polksville, Peasticks and Wyoming. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
